text: Roland Jentsch is a former German curler. He is a former European men's curling champion (1991) and two-time German men's curling champion (1989, 1998; silver in 1988; bronze in 1991, 1996).Curling - Deutsche Meisterschaften His two daughters Daniela Jentsch and Analena Jentsch are well-known German curlers too. ==Teams== ===Men's=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col" width=60| Season ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Alternate ! scope="col"| Coach ! scope="col"| Events |- ! scope="row"| 1978–79 | Roland Jentsch || Hans-Joachim Burba || Wolfgang Burba || Werner Kolb || || || (10th) |- ! scope="row"| 1985–86 | Roland Jentsch || Uli Sutor || Charlie Kapp || Thomas Vogelsang || Rudi Ibald || Otto Danieli || (9th) |- ! scope="row"| 1986–87 | Roland Jentsch || Uli Sutor || Charlie Kapp || Thomas Vogelsang || || || (6th) WCC CR 1986 |- ! scope="row"| 1988–89 | Roland Jentsch || Uli Sutor || Charlie Kapp || Thomas Vogelsang || Andy Kapp || || (8th) |- ! scope="row"| 1991–92 | Roland Jentsch || Uli Sutor || Charlie Kapp || Alexander Huchel || Uli Kapp || || |- ! scope="row"| 1997–98 | Roland Jentsch || Uli Sutor || Florian Zörgiebel || Andreas Kempf || Alexander Huchel || Keith Wendorf || (10th) |} ===Mixed=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Season ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Alternate ! scope="col"| Events |- ! scope="row"| 2006–07 | Roland Jentsch || Daniela Jentsch || Uli Sutor || Marika Trettin || Helmar Erlewein || EMxCC 2006 (10th) |} ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:Living people Category:German male curlers Category:European curling champions Category:German curling champions Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
